sen.j: 朽木 綱紀（くつき つなのり、文化 (元号)4年12月12日 (旧暦)（1808年1月9日） - 文政8年9月4日 (旧暦)（1825年10月15日））は、丹波国福知山藩の世嗣。
sen.e: Tsunanori KUTSUKI (January 9, 1808 - October 15, 1825) was a successor of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Tsunanori KUTSUKI (January 9, 1808 - October 15, 1825) was a successor of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Tsunanori KUTSUKI (January 9, 1808 - October 15, 1825) was a successor of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 第10代藩主・朽木綱方の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of the 10th domain lord, Tsunakata KUCHIKI.
He was the first son of the 10th domain lord, Tsunakata KUTSUKI.
He was the first son of the 10th domain lord, Tsunakata KUTSUKI.
His official court rank was Omi no kuni no kami (governor of Omi Province).
His official court rank was Omi no kuni no kami (governor of Omi Province).
His official court rank was Omi no kuni no kami (governor of Omi Province).

sen.j: 父の後藩主となった第11代藩主・朽木綱条の養子となるが、家督を相続することなく文政8年（1825年）に早世。
sen.e: He became the adopted son of the 11th domain lord, Tsunaeda KUCHIKI, who took over the position of his natural father, but Tsunanori died young in 1825, before succeeding to the family head.
He became the adopted son of the 11th domain lord, Tsunaeda KUTSUKI, who took over the position of his natural father, but Tsunanori died young in 1825, before succeeding to the family head.
He became the adopted son of the 11th domain lord, Tsunaeda KUTSUKI, who took over the position of his natural father, but Tsunanori died young in 1825, before succeeding to the family head.

sen.j: 代わって、近江国膳所藩から朽木綱張が養子に迎えられ嫡子となった。
sen.e: In substitution for him, Tsunaharu KUCHIKI was adopted from Zeze Domain in Omi Province to be the family's legitimate son.
In substitution for him, Tsunaharu KUTSUKI was adopted from Zeze Domain in Omi Province to be the family's legitimate son.
In substitution for him, Tsunaharu KUTSUKI was adopted from Zeze Domain in Omi Province to be the family's legitimate son.
